result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E. Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Charles E. Young was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles E. Young is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Charles E. Young was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Charles E. Young was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Charles E. Young was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Charles E. Young was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Charles E. Young was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  13CM1561/14CM883/15CF35.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Case here for imposition of sentence -

13CM1561 - (Ct 1) - deft sentenced to 20 days KCJ.  Credit for 20 days already served.  Costs shall be paid during his term of probation

15CF35 - (Ct 3) - deft sentenced to 9mos KCJ consecutive to count 1 in 13CM1561.  (Ct 4) - deft sentenced to 5mos KCJ consecutive consecutive to count 3 on this file as well as count 1 in 13CM1561.  Credit for 288 days.  Costs on these two counts shall be paid during his term of probation.

ALL REMAINING COUNTS (count 2 on 13CM1561, counts 1 & 2 on 14CM883, counts 5, 6 & 7 on 15CF35) - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent but consecutive to his jail sentences listed above.  See conditions.

Appeal rights.

Minutes:  13CM1561/14CM883/15CF35.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Sentencing arguments made.  Balance of sentencing hrg adj to 10/23/15 @ 10am.  Court inclined to impose a jail sentence in 14CM883; issue raised whether deft is entitled to credit on that jail sentence from the time he has spent in custody on 15CF35 since deft is on a signature bond in 14CM883.  Attys need a short time to review a decision which came down from the State Supreme Court.

juror question (2)
Preliminary

Appearances:  ADA Krejcarek; Atty Celebre w/DE (I/C).  Alternate juror selected (C.P.--released at 12:05).  Jurors deliberate.  Jurors reached verdict at 2:35.  Deft founds not guilty on cts. 1 & 2.  Deft found guilty on cts. 3 thru 7.  Jurors polled.  Jurors excused at 2:50.  Court finds deft guilty on cts. 3 thru 7.  Sentencing set over to 10/14/15 at 2:00.

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 9:30am.  Testimony continues.  Defense witnesses - Leona Y., & Charles Young.  Defense rests @ 10:31am.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes @ 10:55am.  Oral stipulation read into the record by ADA Krejcarek.  State requests the court take judicial notice that the deft was on bond during the pendency of this case and was not to commit any crimes; no objection by defense.  Rebuttal witness - Sgt. Cooper.  State's exhibits #3, #4, & #5 - offered/received.  Rebuttal rests @ 11:11am.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances.  ADA Krejcarek reports there will be no stipulations.  Brief discussion held.  Court overrules the State's request for no stipulation regarding the elements of the bail jumping charges.  Deft orally stipulates to the elements of the misd. bail jumping charges.  Juror reconvenes @ 1:50pm.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions.  Opening statements given.  Testimony commences.  Testimony taken from P.O. Valeri, P.O. Sheskey, & Sgt. Daniel Cooper.  State rests @ 4:21pm.  Defense motion is reserved.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from - Bessie Y., Jurors released for the day @ 5:02pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 9/23/15.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Voir dire commences.  Jury selected @ noon.  Unselected jurors released @ 12:02pm.  Preliminary instructions given to the selected jurors.  Jurors released @ 12:15pm; instructed to return @ 1:15pm on 9/22/15.

Minutes:  13CM1294/13CM1561/14CM883/15CF35.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Atty Celebre reports the felony file is not resolved at this time and reports the parties have not spoken regarding the misd. files to date.  Parties informed that the Court is disappointed that the parties have not discussed the misd. cases yet and should not assume that resolution of the felony file will resolve the misd. files.  All files are set for trial on 8/31/15.  If the felony file does not proceed to trial on 8/31/15, the parties shall be ready to proceed on the misd cases.  The court will pick & go (1 day case) based on defense counsel's conflict on 9/1/15 with a trial in branch 8.

Minutes:  13CM1294/13CM1561/14CM883/15CF35.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Lara Parker.  Based on the report which was received, defense moves to withdraw their plea of NGI and deft enters a plea of not guilty to all counts in all files and requests a JS date.  No objection by the State.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion for file 15CF35.  State objects to any bond reduction.  Court denies bond motion.  FPT set for 6/17/15 @ 3pm, JS 7/20/15 @ 9am for all files.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Lara Parker. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Parker raises competency issue. Court orders competency evaluation under 971.14(2)(c) to be performed by the Milwaukee Forensic Unit, inpatient. Exam and report to be filed in 15 days. Time limits tolled. Competency hearing on 2-4-15 @ 9:50am with 14CM883, 13CM1561, and 13CM1294. Bond continued.
